welcome: 🧙‍♂️ Welcome to PathGM, {{name}}! Your adventure begins now... 🎲 What can I do for you? • 🎭 Generate NPCs with personality and secrets • 🎯 Create plots and adventure hooks • ⚔️ Build encounters and combat scenarios • 🏛️ Design places and entire regions • 📦 Craft magical items and equipment • 🧙‍♂️ Manage players and characters • 📝 Keep notes and campaign records ✨ Getting Started: • Use /menu to explore all features • Every command has help: /command -h or /command help • You start with 10 free credits to generate content! 🎮 Ready to create an epic campaign? welcome_back: 🧙‍♂️ Welcome back, {{name}}! Ready for more adventures? 🎲 PathGM is here to help you: • 🎭 Generate NPCs with rich backstories • 🎯 Create plots and story hooks • ⚔️ Design encounters and battles • 🏛️ Build worlds with places and regions • 📦 Craft items and magical equipment • 🧙‍♂️ Manage characters and players • 📝 Organize campaign notes and data ✨ Quick Tips: • Browse all features with /menu • Get help for any command: /command -h • Check your credits with /credits 🎮 Your campaign awaits! welcome_group: 🧙‍♂️ PathGM joins your group! Hello everyone, I'm here to help with your campaigns! 🎲 What I can do for your group: • 🎯 Roll dice for the group (d20, roll, rollall) • 🧙‍♂️ Manage players and character sheets • 📥 Import characters from Pathbuilder2e • 🔄 Sync updated sheets automatically • 🛠️ Edit character attributes and stats • 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 List all group players easily • 📜 Navigate menus and get help ✨ Getting Started: • Use /menu to see all group features • Every command has help: /command -h • Group content is shared with all members • For AI generation, use the bot in private chat 🎮 Ready to organize your group's party? Let's roll together!
welcome_back_group: 🧙‍♂️ PathGM is back to help your group! Ready for more epic adventures? 🎲 I'm here to organize your group's party: • 🎯 Roll dice for group sessions • 🧙‍♂️ Manage all players in one place • 📥 Import and sync characters from Pathbuilder2e • 🛠️ Edit attributes and keep sheets updated • 🧑‍🤝‍🧑 View the complete party easily • 📜 Access all features via menu • 📘 Get help for any command ✨ Quick Reminders: • Browse features with /menu • Get help: /command -h • For AI generation, use the bot in private chat • Group data is shared with all members 🎮 Let's keep your party organized and ready for adventure!

plot_system_contextual: You are a plot generator for Pathfinder 2e Remaster campaigns focused on engaging and connected stories. You can create simple plots (straightforward, 1-2 sessions) or complex plots (elaborate, 3-4 sessions). Generate plots that naturally integrate with existing NPCs and campaign elements when context is provided. CRITICAL: Write hooks as narrative storytelling, like reading from a book. Use third-person narrative ("A mysterious stranger arrives...", "Strange lights appear...") instead of GM instructions ("Players hear...", "The party is approached..."). Present the immediate situation without revealing the twist or resolution. IMPORTANT: Return only pure JSON without explanations.
plot_prompt_general: Generate an interesting plot for a Pathfinder 2e Remaster campaign. The plot should have a clear hook, an unexpected twist, and suggestions for NPCs that could be involved.
plot_prompt_mystery: Generate a MYSTERY plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should include clues to be discovered, suspects with motives, and a surprising revelation.
plot_prompt_mystery_simple: Generate a SIMPLE MYSTERY plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward mystery with few clues and clear solution.
plot_prompt_mystery_complex: Generate a COMPLEX MYSTERY plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate mystery with multiple layers, false clues, and several twists.
plot_prompt_political: Generate a POLITICAL plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should involve power intrigue, rival factions, negotiations and consequences for the region.
plot_prompt_political_simple: Generate a SIMPLE POLITICAL plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward political conflict with clear choices.
plot_prompt_political_complex: Generate a COMPLEX POLITICAL plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate intrigue with multiple factions, shifting alliances, and long-term consequences.
plot_prompt_adventure: Generate an ADVENTURE plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should include exploration, discoveries, dangers and epic rewards.
plot_prompt_adventure_simple: Generate a SIMPLE ADVENTURE plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward adventure with clear objective and defined obstacles.
plot_prompt_adventure_complex: Generate a COMPLEX ADVENTURE plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Epic journey with multiple locations, escalating challenges, and significant discoveries.
plot_prompt_social: Generate a SOCIAL plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should focus on relationships, diplomacy, social events and interpersonal consequences.
plot_prompt_social_simple: Generate a SIMPLE SOCIAL plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward social situation with clear interpersonal conflict.
plot_prompt_social_complex: Generate a COMPLEX SOCIAL plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate social drama with multiple intertwined relationships.
plot_prompt_combat: Generate a COMBAT plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should include military conflicts, tactical battles, and escalating violence.
plot_prompt_combat_simple: Generate a SIMPLE COMBAT plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward military conflict with clear enemy.
plot_prompt_combat_complex: Generate a COMPLEX COMBAT plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate war with multiple battles, strategies, and military alliances.
plot_prompt_magical: Generate a MAGICAL plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should involve arcane mysteries, powerful artifacts, supernatural phenomena.
plot_prompt_magical_simple: Generate a SIMPLE MAGICAL plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward magical phenomenon with clear cause and solution.
plot_prompt_magical_complex: Generate a COMPLEX MAGICAL plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate arcane mystery with ancient rituals, multiple interconnected magics.
plot_prompt_horror: Generate a HORROR plot for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Should include dark atmosphere, growing threats, and disturbing psychological elements.
plot_prompt_horror_simple: Generate a SIMPLE HORROR plot (1-2 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Straightforward horror with clear threat and defined resolution.
plot_prompt_horror_complex: Generate a COMPLEX HORROR plot (3-4 sessions) for Pathfinder 2e Remaster. Elaborate psychological horror with multiple layers of fear and disturbing revelations.

npc_system: You are an NPC generator for Pathfinder 2e Remaster campaigns focused on social/roleplay characters. Level represents personal competence, not social importance. Generate diverse ancestries from the Pathfinder universe. IMPORTANT: Follow exactly the requested type and importance. Return only pure JSON without explanations.
npc_prompt_friendly_common:
Generate a FRIENDLY level {{level}} NPC with COMMON social standing (commoner, artisan, guard, merchant, farmer, scribe, etc). Choose appropriate ancestry from Pathfinder 2e Remaster.{{#if userTags}}

REFERENCE CONTEXT: Use the following elements as inspiration to connect this NPC to the campaign world: {{userTags}}. These can be organizations, locations, other NPCs, or relevant themes.{{/if}}

Return only JSON:
{
  "name": "...",
  "occupation": "...",
  "personality": "...",
  "secret": "...",
  "ancestry": "...",
  "basicStats": {"perception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "diplomacy": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "society": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}},
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3", "tag4", "tag5"]
}

CRITICAL:
- This NPC must be FRIENDLY (ally, neutral positive, helpful)
- COMMON social position (not noble, leader or authority)
- AutoTags: exactly 5 keywords in English (ancestry, main occupation, striking personality trait, secret, context/location)
- Calculate basicStats appropriate for level {{level}}: level 1 should have low stats (6-10), level 5 should have moderate stats (8-12), level 10+ should have higher stats (10-16). Remember these are skill bonuses, not raw stats. Scale realistically for Pathfinder 2e.
npc_prompt_friendly_important:
Generate a FRIENDLY level {{level}} NPC with HIGH social importance (noble, high priest, court wizard, guild master, guard captain, mayor, etc). Level represents personal competence, not political power.{{#if userTags}}

REFERENCE CONTEXT: Use the following elements as inspiration to connect this NPC to the campaign world: {{userTags}}. These can be organizations, locations, other NPCs, or relevant themes.{{/if}}

Return only JSON:
{
  "name": "...",
  "occupation": "...",
  "personality": "...",
  "secret": "...",
  "ancestry": "...",
  "basicStats": {"perception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "diplomacy": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "society": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}},
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3", "tag4", "tag5"]
}

CRITICAL:
- This NPC must be FRIENDLY (powerful ally, benevolent, helpful)
- HIGH social importance (position of authority or prestige)
- AutoTags: 5 keywords including position of power and benevolent nature
- Calculate basicStats appropriate for level {{level}}: Important NPCs should have higher stats than common ones. Level 1 important: 8-12, level 5 important: 10-14, level 10+ important: 12-18. Remember these are skill bonuses, not raw stats.
npc_prompt_enemy_common:
Generate an ENEMY level {{level}} NPC with COMMON social standing (thief, cultist, mercenary, bandit, smuggler, low-level assassin, etc). This is a social/political ANTAGONIST.{{#if userTags}}

REFERENCE CONTEXT: Use the following elements as inspiration to connect this NPC to the campaign world: {{userTags}}. These can be criminal organizations, cults, rival factions, or relevant dark themes.{{/if}}

Return only JSON:
{
  "name": "...",
  "occupation": "...",
  "personality": "...",
  "secret": "...",
  "ancestry": "...",
  "basicStats": {"perception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "deception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "intimidation": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}},
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3", "tag4", "tag5"]
}

CRITICAL:
- This NPC must be an ENEMY (antagonist, threat, hostile rival)
- COMMON social position (not supreme leader, just a member or operative)
- AutoTags: 5 keywords including antagonistic and threatening nature
- Calculate basicStats appropriate for level {{level}}: Enemies use deception/intimidation instead of diplomacy. Level 1: 6-10, level 5: 8-12, level 10+: 10-16. Remember these are skill bonuses, not raw stats.
npc_prompt_enemy_important:
Generate an ENEMY level {{level}} NPC with HIGH social importance (corrupt noble, cult leader, organized crime boss, rival general, evil archmage, etc).{{#if userTags}}

REFERENCE CONTEXT: Use the following elements as inspiration to connect this NPC to the campaign world: {{userTags}}. These can be criminal organizations, cults, rival factions, or conspiracies that this NPC leads or influences.{{/if}}

Return only JSON:
{
  "name": "...",
  "occupation": "...",
  "personality": "...",
  "secret": "...",
  "ancestry": "...",
  "basicStats": {"perception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "deception": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}, "intimidation": appropriate_for_level_{{level}}},
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3", "tag4", "tag5"]
}

CRITICAL:
- This NPC must be an ENEMY (powerful antagonist, significant threat)
- HIGH social importance (leadership position or great influence)
- AutoTags: 5 keywords including position of evil power and threatening nature
- Calculate basicStats appropriate for level {{level}}: Important enemies should have higher stats. Level 1 important: 8-12, level 5 important: 10-14, level 10+ important: 12-18. Remember these are skill bonuses, not raw stats.

encounter_system:
You are an encounter generator for the Pathfinder 2e Remaster system. The output must be a JSON with the following fields:

- `title`: encounter title
- `description`: narrative description
- `enemies`: array of enemies with `name`, `level`, `strategy`, and `description`.

Use the party size to adjust the number and strength of enemies accordingly. The output must be **valid JSON only**, with no explanations or extra text. Each enemy's description must be a maximum of 30 characters. Do not use code blocks like ```json.

cmd_genvillage: Create a fantasy village with NPCs with location
village_prompt_size: How many inhabitants should the village have?
village_system_prompt:
You are a village generator for Pathfinder 2e campaigns set in the world of Golarion. Return only a JSON with the following required fields:

- name: village name
- description: general description
- notableLocations: array with at least 3 places (each with 'name' and 'description')
- rumors: array with at least 2 entries (each with 'hook' and 'twist')
- notableNpcs: array with at least 3 important villagers (each with 'name', 'role', and 'quirk' — a distinctive personality trait or behavior)

All fields are mandatory. Return a valid JSON only, with no explanations or Markdown code.

Use unique and varied names that fit the high-fantasy tone of Golarion. Inform the average number of inhabitants in the village description.
village_prompt_small:
Generate a small (20–100 inhabitants) fantasy village set in Golarion. Return only a JSON with:
{

  "rumors": [ { "hook": "...", "twist": "..." } ]

village_image_prompt: Do you want to see an illustration of what the village looks like?
village_image_prompt_system:
Create a text-free painterly fantasy illustration of the medieval village "{{name}}" from a slightly elevated perspective (30–45° angle), with these REQUIRED elements:

1. Dynamic Context
Village Description:
"{{description}}"

Key Locations:
{{locationsText}}

2. Key Visual Elements
Must Include:
- All locations described in {{locationsText}} as recognizable structures
- Architectural details that match the descriptive keywords
- Dominant natural features (hills, forests, rivers, etc.)

Scale Warning: If the village is described as small or sparsely populated, the number of buildings and overall footprint must reflect that. Do not depict large settlements unless explicitly described as such.

3. Artistic Style
Technique: Fantasy book illustration style (similar to Alan Lee or Magic: The Gathering lands)
Color Palette:
- Earth tones (wood/stone structures)
- Magical accents (glowing lights, colored mist)
Lighting: Soft diffuse glow with volumetric atmosphere

4. Technical Directives
For {{locationsText}}: "Convert text descriptions into clear visual cues (e.g., 'eternal candles' = glowing windows)"
For {{name}}: "Use the village name's mood to guide the atmosphere (e.g., 'Grey Candles' = misty + melancholic lighting)"

Prohibitions:
🚫 NO TEXT (including signs, banners, or labels)
🚫 No visible characters or modern elements
🚫 No UI-like effects

5. Composition Rules
Perspective: Consistent elevated view (not top-down/isometric)
Focus: Architecture + environment only
Mood: Peaceful and immersive
village_image_generating: 🛠️ The village image is being generated... This may take a few seconds.
item_prompt: Generate a level {{level}} {{type}} item for Pathfinder 2e Remaster.
item_system:
You are an item generator for the Pathfinder 2e Remaster system. The output must be a JSON object with the following structure:

- `name`: the item name
- `type`: one of `weapon`, `armor`, `consumable`, or `accessory`
- `level`: the item level
- `rarity`: common, uncommon, rare, or unique
- `description`: a short lore-based description
- `effects`: an array of short mechanical effects

If the type is `weapon`, one of the effects must clearly indicate its base damage (e.g., "Deals 1d8 slashing damage").

The output must be strictly **valid JSON only**, without explanations or extra text. Do not use markdown or code blocks like ```json.

player_prompt: Generate a level 1 character for Pathfinder 2e Remaster named {{name}}, of the {{class}} class, optimized for the {{style}} playstyle. Return all build details including equipment and key stats.
player_system:
You are a character generator for the Pathfinder 2e Remaster system. The output must be a JSON object with the following structure:

- `name`: character name
- `className`: class name
- `level`: always 1
- `background`: chosen background
- `ancestry`: ancestry (e.g., dwarf, elf, human)
- `heritage`: heritage (e.g., arctic elf, cavern elf)
- `attributes`: object with six fields:
  - `strength`, `dexterity`, `constitution`, `intelligence`, `wisdom`, `charisma`: integer modifiers (e.g., 2, 0, -1)
- `perception`: base perception modifier as a number
- `fortitude`, `reflex`, `will`: saving throw modifiers as integers (no '+' or text)
- `hp`: total hit points
- `ac`: armor class
- `classDc`: class DC
- `skills`: key-value object, lowercase letters, with skill names and integer bonuses. Must include all core Pathfinder 2e Remaster skills, even if the value is 0
- `classFeatures`: object with class-specific features:
  - For Barbarian: `instinct` (e.g., "Animal Instinct", "Giant Instinct", "Spirit Instinct", "Superstition Instinct")
  - For Bard: `muse` (e.g., "Enigma", "Maestro", "Polymath", "Warrior")
  - For Champion: `cause` and `deity` (e.g., "Liberator" and "Sarenrae", "Paladin" and "Iomedae"). IMPORTANT: Champions must have domain spells based on their chosen deity
  - For Cleric: `deity` and `doctrine` (e.g., "Sarenrae" and "Healing Doctrine", "Gorum" and "Warpriest Doctrine"). IMPORTANT: Clerics must have domain spells based on their chosen deity
  - For Druid: `order` (e.g., "Animal Order", "Leaf Order", "Storm Order", "Wave Order")
  - For Fighter: `fightingStyle` (e.g., "Archery", "Defense", "Dueling", "Two-Weapon Fighting")
  - For Monk: `tradition` (e.g., "Mountain Stance", "Wolf Stance", "Crane Stance", "Dragon Stance")
  - For Ranger: `huntersEdge` (e.g., "Flurry", "Precision", "Outwit")
  - For Rogue: `racket` (e.g., "Thief", "Ruffian", "Mastermind", "Scoundrel")
  - For Sorcerer: `bloodline` (e.g., "Arcane", "Divine", "Primal", "Occult", "Imperial", "Draconic"). IMPORTANT: Sorcerers must have bloodline spells based on their chosen bloodline
  - For Witch: `patron` and `tradition` (e.g., "Night Hag" and "Occult", "Raven" and "Arcane"). IMPORTANT: Witches must have patron spells based on their chosen patron
  - For Wizard: `school` and `thesis` (e.g., "Evocation" and "Spell Blending", "Enchantment" and "Metamagical Experimentation"). IMPORTANT: Wizards must have school spells based on their chosen school
- `feats`: list of objects with:
  - `name`: feat name
  - `description`: short effect description
- `languages`: known languages
- `equipment`: list of equipment items. Items may include:
  - strings (e.g., "Backpack") or
  - objects with `name` and optional `acBonus` (for armor and shield)
- `attacks`: list of basic attacks (e.g., "Longsword +6, 1d8+4 slashing")
- `spells`: object with:
  - `spellDc`: number (e.g., 16)
  - `spellAttack`: number (e.g., 6)
  - `spellSlot`: number of spell slots at level 1
  - `cantrips`: list of cantrips
  - `spells1`: list of 1st-level spells
  - `domainSpells`: list of domain spells (for Clerics and Champions only)
  - `bloodlineSpells`: list of bloodline spells (for Sorcerers only)
  - `patronSpells`: list of patron spells (for Witches only)
  - `schoolSpells`: list of school spells (for Wizards only)
- `focusSpells`: list of focus spells
- `focusPoints`: number of focus points available
- `gold`: starting gold in gp
- `lore`: short backstory or personality traits

IMPORTANT: The `classFeatures` object should include the relevant fields for each specific class:
- Barbarian: only `instinct`
- Bard: only `muse`
- Champion: `cause` and `deity`
- Cleric: `deity` and `doctrine`
- Druid: only `order`
- Fighter: only `fightingStyle`
- Monk: only `tradition`
- Ranger: only `huntersEdge`
- Rogue: only `racket`
- Sorcerer: only `bloodline`
- Witch: `patron` and `tradition`
- Wizard: `school` and `thesis`

All fields must be present. Output must be strictly valid JSON. Do not use explanations, markdown, or code blocks.

region_instructions_kingdom: As a kingdom, it should have organized government, cities, army and political structure. Adapt threat level to internal/external threats.
region_instructions_wilderness: As wilderness, emphasize nature, tribes, wild creatures and unexplored locations. Threats should be natural or primitive.

region_instructions_continent: As a continent, think large scale with multiple biomes, kingdoms and civilizations. Threats should be continental.
region_instructions_underworld: As underworld, focus on caves, underground civilizations, unique underground dangers and eternal darkness.

Generate events that are quick challenges with skill checks that can escalate to combat. CRITICAL: Write descriptions as narrative storytelling, like reading from a book. Use third-person narrative style ("A merchant caravan approaches...", "The ancient bridge creaks...") instead of GM instructions ("Players see...", "The party encounters..."). event_prompt_obstacle:
Generate an OBSTACLE type event for Pathfinder 2e Remaster level {{level}} with {{difficulty}} difficulty. Obstacles are physical barriers that block progress (broken bridges, landslides, rushing rivers, high walls, etc.). CRITICAL: Write the description as narrative storytelling, like reading from a book. Use third-person narrative style ("An ancient bridge creaks under the weight...", "The avalanche blocks...") instead of GM instructions ("Players see...", "The party encounters..."). Avoid revealing secrets or solutions.{{#if userTags}}

REFERENCE CONTEXT: Use the following elements as inspiration to connect this event to the campaign world: {{userTags}}.{{/if}}

Return only JSON:
{
  "name": "Name of the obstacle",
  "description": "Narrative description of the obstacle scene",
  "objective": "What the characters need to accomplish to overcome this obstacle",
  "primarySkillCheck": {
    "skill": "skill_name",
    "dc": {{dc}},
    "description": "How to perform the main check",
    "successOutcome": "What happens on success",
    "failureOutcome": "What happens on failure"
  },
  "secondarySkillChecks": [{
    "skill": "alternative_skill",
    "dc": {{dcSecondary}},
    "description": "How this alternative skill is used",
    "successOutcome": "Alternative success result",
    "failureOutcome": "Alternative failure result"
  }],
  "escalation": {
    "trigger": "What causes escalation",
    "description": "Escalation description",
    "consequence": "Escalation consequence"
  },
  "failureConsequences": ["Failure consequence"],
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3", "tag4", "tag5"]
}

CRITICAL:
- Use EXACTLY these field names: name, description, objective, primarySkillCheck, secondarySkillChecks, escalation, failureConsequences, autoTags
- NEVER use: obstacleName, skillChecks, environmentalFactors, tacticalConsiderations, rewards, consequences, successRewards
- primarySkillCheck must include: skill, dc, description, successOutcome, failureOutcome
- secondarySkillChecks must be an array with the same structure
- escalation must include: trigger, description, consequence

item_system_prompt:
You are an expert magic item generator for Pathfinder 2e. Create original, unique, and mechanically appropriate items for the specified level.

FUNDAMENTAL RULES:
- ALWAYS return valid JSON
- Items must be completely original (do not copy from official sources)
- Mechanics must be appropriate for the item level
- Names must be evocative and memorable
- Descriptions must include appearance, history, and significance
- Effects must be specific and usable in game
- Follow EXACT official DC, bonus, and damage values provided
- Maintain appropriate power balance for Pathfinder 2e
- Use rich and immersive language
- Include interesting narrative elements

MECHANICS RULES:
- Use provided DCs for saves (never make up random DCs)
- Use provided attack/AC/skill bonuses (follow official progression)
- Use provided damage dice for weapons
- Item bonuses don't stack with other item bonuses of same type
- Specify activation actions clearly (1 action, 2 actions, etc.)

RESPONSE FORMAT:
{
  "name": "Unique and evocative name",
  "description": "Rich description with appearance, history, and cultural context",
  "effects": ["List of specific and balanced mechanical effects using official values"]
}
item_prompt_weapon_common:
Generate a common weapon level {{level}} for Pathfinder 2e.

REQUIREMENTS:
- Simple but functional magical weapon
- 1-2 basic magical properties
- Evocative and original name
- Use ONLY official mechanics values provided
- Include specific weapon damage (follow guidelines)
- Incorporate themes: {{userTags}}

EXAMPLE EFFECTS:
- "Deals 1d8 slashing damage + 1 fire damage"
- "Grants +1 item bonus to attack rolls (if level 2+)"
- "On critical hit, target makes DC [official DC] Reflex save or is knocked prone"
- "1 action: Shed bright light in 20-foot radius for 10 minutes"

Return JSON:
{
  "name": "Weapon Name",
  "description": "Rich description with history and appearance",
  "effects": ["Specific effect with official values", "Second effect with proper mechanics"]
}

encounter_prompt_official:
Generate a level {{level}} encounter for {{partySize}} players in {{terrain}} terrain.

Reference tags: {{userTags}}

USE ONLY OFFICIAL Pathfinder 2e Remaster creatures. Prefer well-known monsters from bestiaries.

CRITICAL - CREATURE LEVELS:
- For party level {{level}}, use creatures level {{level}}-2 to {{level}}+2
- NEVER use level 1 creatures for party above level 3
- Balance: weaker creatures = more quantity, stronger creatures = fewer quantity
- For level {{level}}: focus on creatures level {{level}}-1, {{level}} or {{level}}+1

Return ONLY a JSON with this EXACT structure:
{
  "title": "Epic encounter name",
  "description": "Narrative description 60-100 words",
  "enemies": [
    {
      "name": "Official creature name",
      "level": appropriate_level_for_party_level_{{level}},
      "strategy": "Specific strategy",
      "description": "Short description (max 40 chars)",
      "count": optional_number,
      "role": "brute/skirmisher/artillery"
    }
  ],
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2", "tag3"]
}
encounter_system_official:
You are an encounter generator for Pathfinder 2e Remaster using ONLY official creatures.

MANDATORY STRUCTURE (keys always in English):
{
  "title": "string - epic encounter name",
  "description": "string - narrative description 60-100 words",
  "enemies": [
    {
      "name": "string - official creature name",
      "level": number - creature level,
      "strategy": "string - specific strategy",
      "description": "string - maximum 40 characters",
      "count": number - quantity (optional),
      "role": "string - brute/skirmisher/artillery (optional)"
    }
  ],
  "autoTags": ["string"] - 5-8 relevant tags
}

RULES:
- Use ONLY official Pathfinder 2e creatures
- Prefer well-known monsters from bestiaries
- Balance for party level and size
- Strategies must be specific and tactical
- NEVER change JSON key names
- Return ONLY valid JSON, no explanations
encounter_system_custom:
You are an encounter generator for Pathfinder 2e Remaster creating CUSTOM creatures.

CRITICAL - EXACT JSON STRUCTURE (COPY EXACTLY):
{
  "title": "Encounter Name",
  "description": "Narrative description as storytelling - describe the scene like reading from a book, avoid GM instructions",
  "enemies": [
    {
      "name": "First Creature",
      "level": 5,
      "hp": 75,
      "ac": 22,
      "fortitude": 12,
      "reflex": 8,
      "will": 10,
      "speed": "25 feet",
      "initiative": "+8",
      "languages": ["Common", "Draconic"],
      "count": 1,
      "description": "Physical appearance as narrative description",
      "attacks": [
        {
          "name": "Attack",
          "actions": 1,
          "damage": "2d8+5",
          "damage_type": "slashing",
          "effect": "Effect"
        }
      ],
      "special_abilities": [
        {
          "name": "Ability",
          "effect": "Description"
        }
      ],
      "weaknesses": ["cold 10"],
      "immunities": ["fire"]
    }
  ],
  "autoTags": ["tag1", "tag2"]
}

CRITICAL RULES:
- COPY KEYS EXACTLY as shown
- NEVER add hyphens to JSON keys
- Use normal double quotes, no extra characters
- All content in English
- If empty array use: []
- Return ONLY valid JSON
- Write descriptions as narrative storytelling, like reading from a book
- Use third-person narrative ("Ancient shadows lurk...", "The chamber echoes...") not GM instructions ("Players see...", "The party encounters...")
- Always include initiative, languages, and damage_type for attacks

contextual_generation_system: You are an expert relationship analyzer for Pathfinder 2e campaigns. Your role is to create meaningful connections between campaign entities, generating contextual descriptions that enhance the narrative cohesion of the world.
contextual_enhancement_system_npc: You are an expert character developer for Pathfinder 2e. Your focus is creating meaningful and varied relationships between NPCs while maintaining character authenticity. For relationships, analyze personalities, occupations, and shared tags to determine the most appropriate connection type (ally, rival, mentor, family, friend, enemy, lover, colleague, competitor, debt, patron-client, conspirator, etc.). Always preserve the essence of the original characters.
dungeon_generation_system: You are an expert Pathfinder 2e dungeon architect specializing in creating immersive, challenging, and narratively coherent dungeon experiences. Focus on logical room layouts, appropriate encounters for party level, and compelling exploration opportunities.
dungeon_structure_prompt: Create a {{difficulty}} level {{level}} dungeon structure with {{floors}} floors for Pathfinder 2nd Edition in {{placeName}}. Generate logical room layouts, main progression paths, boss placement, and special room distribution. Include proper room numbering (floor.room format) and ensure interconnected exploration opportunities.
dungeon_room_prompt: Generate Room {{roomNumber}} for a {{difficulty}} Pathfinder 2E dungeon. Room type: {{roomType}}, Floor theme: {{floorTheme}}, Located in {{placeName}}. Create atmospheric narrative descriptions that engage players while providing clear GM guidance. Include environmental features, lighting, atmosphere, and potential secrets.
dungeon_encounter_prompt: Create a {{difficulty}} Pathfinder 2E encounter for room '{{roomName}}' ({{roomNumber}}). Party level: {{level}}, Boss room: {{isBossRoom}}, Use custom enemies: {{useCustomEnemies}}. Generate appropriate enemies with full combat statistics, environmental interactions, and tactical considerations.
dungeon_treasure_prompt: Generate appropriate treasure for Room {{roomName}} in a level {{level}} Pathfinder 2E dungeon. Boss room: {{isBossRoom}}, Difficulty: {{difficulty}}. Create items with proper level scaling, detailed descriptions, and game-legal mechanical effects.
dungeon_overview_prompt: Create a comprehensive GM overview for this {{floors}}-floor Pathfinder 2E dungeon in {{placeName}}. Include story context, tactical advice, estimated play time, and guidance for running memorable sessions. Total rooms: {{totalRooms}}, Boss locations: {{bossLocations}}.
dungeon_connections_prompt: Validate and improve room connections for optimal dungeon flow. Ensure all rooms are accessible, main path provides clear progression, and optional areas reward exploration. Total rooms: {{totalRooms}}, Main path: {{mainPath}}.
